content: hey @njn, does your PTO run through this week too?
whoops, I mean @njn ^
I'm planning/assuming that we should hold our meeting at the previously agreed on day-of-week (namely Tuesdays) and time
but I know things might be confused now, since we held the first meeting on a Wednesday
Yes, I am on PTO this week too.
I also don't know if I'll be able to spend time on rustc stuff moving forward, given how much everything has been shaken up :( Will have to wait and see
@njn :'( sending hugs (if you want some), the whole thing sucks
I think I am pretty much free for both tomorrow and the day after, assuming it's at a similar time as before in EST
(@pnkfelix)
@njn okay. I totally understand if you won't be able to continue participating in this wg (or contributing to rustc in general) going forward.
I will for now continue to use the time slot that we have allocated.
@njn hugs!, hope you're able to continue doing the awesome work you do
just in case, is not entirely clear to me when do we have the next meeting but I'm assuming that it will be added to the compiler team calendar
hi again everyone
I didn't actually add the meeting to the compiler team calendar; that was an oversight on my part. (@Santiago Pastorino had pointed it out to me separately earlier today.)
Who among @wg-incr-comp is around now for a meeting?
I’ve made a mistake by being awake at this time, staying up until 2am wouldn’t be advisable. Have a good meeting folks.
heh
not a good sign when the only response is someone saying "whoops I'm actually going to bed"
I am around, but I didn't know we were gonna have it today :cold_sweat:

pnkfelix said:

I'm planning/assuming that we should hold our meeting at the previously agreed on day-of-week (namely Tuesdays) and time

yeah, this was my fault. In my head had though the above statement was trying to establish a Tuesday rhythm\
It's okay :)
but honestly it is fine with me if we don't try to hold the meeting tonight. I'm exhausted and also I have nothing to report.
I don't think I can today tho
Yeah
I'm exactly the same XD
maybe I should make a calendar event for Tuesday of next week
that way we can all have something to shoot for. (Apart from people who cannot make. this time slot in the first. place)
(I (a) have nothing to report and (b) am also pretty tired, I think I'll take the rest of the day easy)
Sure! Having something to shoot for seems like a good idea :)
That way I might prioritize reading the CGU code, which is something I wanna do but haven't yet. I want to understand it well so that I can help Wesley :)
Oh, just saw this :)
Sorry, I didn't realize the early message meant we had a meeting scheduled for tonight.
Okay so I'm officially going to say that the second meeting isn't being held tonight
and I'll go see about making an event ... oh
(I just realized something else I. should do that has to do with administrative stuff)

I have a PR open to refactor the cgu partitioning code (no behavioral changes). @pnkfelix are you interested in doing the review? If not, that's totally fine and I can assign to someone else.

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/74275
ugh sorry for letting that slide so long @Wesley Wiser
It's totally fine, there's been no rush.
at some point I had a list of running URLs. that I should skim every day
but then I stopped
and reviews went back to falling by wayside. ugh.
If you want to do the review, I don't mind waiting for that. :smile:
Maybe take some off your plate, I think it's okay if you do @pnkfelix :)
well I have some time right now since the meeting isn't happening. :)

I had a thought earlier today that it might be good to sift through the issues on rust-lang/rust and make sure things are tagged with the incremental tag. During the previous meeting, some of the enhancements we found weren't tagged with A-incr-comp.
I'll try to do some of that now since there's time
@pnkfelix I know you were interested in spinning up project groups for specific things the incr-comp group was going to work on. Is there already an established process for doing that?
for spinning up project groups?

And how soon is too soon to do that? I feel like we're still thing to figure out exactly what changes we want to make to the cgu algorithm. Or perhaps that would be part of the project group's mandate (to figure that out)?
Yeah
Is it this? https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/blob/master/text/2856-project-groups.md
Oh ok
The start date totally threw me lol
(Gotta step away; thank goodness we don’t have a mtg after all. Talk tomorrow.)

Hey, I'm also interested in this work group, especially around things that deal with MIR opt. I don't have expereince with MIR or incremental compile, but these are topics that interest me and I want learn about them. I do have some experience with rustc and have been working on RFC: 2229 (Capturing disjoing fields in a closure).

I have fair bit of time on my hands for the next month, so if there are some beginner tasks that would need help, let me know :)
When is the next meeting?
hopefully Tuesday
this time I put it onto the T-compiler team calendar
(google calendar)
thank you
@pnkfelix I can't open that link; is there something one has to do beforehand?
@Félix Fischer no I don’t think so. We’re still figuring things out so we don’t have any standing agenda/protocol for the meetings.
I should put the meeting timing in a more public place. I suppose I’ll also need to do something about the zoom info.
(The meeting is password protected, a protocol zoom now requires. I’ll PM the info to @Aman Arora and @Félix Fischer, and anyone else who PM’s me and says they want to attend.)
remember to record the meeting :)
Given the time of the meeting, I won't be able to attend so I'd also appreciate a recording.
I created a hackmd to collect things to talk about during the meeting: https://hackmd.io/c9c3CyUSQbq4AopK1j95Gw
I'll probably have to skip this one. Something important happened and I will need to be away at 8. Have a good one, everybody <3
@njn just a friendly ping so you know the meeting is happening now.
How did it go?
I finally posted the meeting video: https://youtu.be/t5NxS2NcbOU
sorry it took so long everyone! (I had to get permissions enabled (again) because I don't have my old Mozilla account on YouTube anymore)
Only thing that I'd add to everyone's check-in during the meeting is that I got lucky with #76030 and improved incremental perf since the last meeting.
https://github.com/rust-lang/wg-incr-comp/pull/3 to keep track of our meetings so far
